name: Miriam
description: Prophetess, sister of Moses and Aaron. As a child, watched over Moses in his basket and boldly secured their mother as his nurse. Led the women in song at the Sea. Challenged Moses and was struck with leprosy, healed by his prayer. The well followed Israel for her merit.

watching-basket.name: Watching the Basket
watching-basket.description: Young Miriam hidden among reeds, watching baby Moses
watching-basket.prompt: young girl crouched among papyrus reeds at the Nile - eyes fixed on a basket floating in the water, face showing protective anxiety and clever watchfulness. 'His sister stood at a distance to know what would be done to him.' The first act of saving Moses.

approaching-princess.name: Approaching Pharaoh's Daughter
approaching-princess.description: Young Miriam boldly offers to find a Hebrew nurse
approaching-princess.prompt: young girl approaching Egyptian princess - bold and clever, offering help. 'Shall I go and call a Hebrew nursing woman for you?' The quick-thinking that brought Moses back to his own mother. Bare feet, simple Hebrew garment, facing Egyptian royalty without fear.

timbrel-song.name: Timbrel and Song
timbrel-song.description: Miriam leading the women in dance at the Red Sea
timbrel-song.prompt: prophetess with timbrel raised high - leading women in dance and song, face radiant with triumph. 'Sing to the LORD, for He has triumphed gloriously!' The sea behind them, Pharaoh's army destroyed, freedom realized. Hair perhaps wild with dancing, women with timbrels following.

prophetess-leading.name: The Prophetess
prophetess-leading.description: Miriam in her role as prophetess and leader
prophetess-leading.prompt: standing in prophetic dignity - mature woman with presence and authority. Timbrel perhaps at her side, garments of a prophetess. One of the three leaders God sent before Israel. 'Miriam the prophetess, sister of Aaron.'

challenging-moses.name: Speaking Against Moses
challenging-moses.description: Miriam and Aaron questioning Moses's unique status
challenging-moses.prompt: speaking with Aaron, perhaps gesturing toward Moses - face showing challenge and wounded pride. 'Has the LORD spoken only through Moses? Has He not spoken through us also?' The moment before divine judgment. Near the Tent of Meeting, cloud present.

struck-with-leprosy.name: White as Snow
struck-with-leprosy.description: Miriam struck with leprosy, humbled by God
struck-with-leprosy.prompt: standing or falling - skin turned white as snow with leprosy. Face showing shock transforming to acceptance. Aaron turning to see her, Moses preparing to pray. The prophetess humbled. 'And behold, Miriam was leprous, white as snow.'

outside-camp.name: Seven Days Outside
outside-camp.description: Miriam waiting outside the camp during her healing
outside-camp.prompt: sitting or standing outside the camp - waiting in exile for seven days. The camp visible in background, but she separated. Face showing quiet acceptance, perhaps hope of restoration. The prophetess humbled but not destroyed.

restored-prophetess.name: Restored to the Camp
restored-prophetess.description: Miriam healed and returning to Israel
restored-prophetess.prompt: walking back into the camp - healed, restored, humbled but dignified. Israel waited for her: 'The people did not journey until Miriam was brought back.' Honored despite her error, essential to the nation.

well-of-miriam.name: The Well of Miriam
well-of-miriam.description: Miriam associated with the miraculous well
well-of-miriam.prompt: standing near a miraculous well in the wilderness - water flowing, the source that followed Israel for her merit. Perhaps hands raised in blessing over the water, or drawing water for others. The Midrash: 'The well was in the merit of Miriam.'

rivalry-watching-basket.name: Rivalry: Watching the Basket
rivalry-watching-basket.description: Young Miriam protecting baby Moses in the Nile
rivalry-watching-basket.prompt: Young Miriam hiding among the reeds, watching over the basket containing baby Moses. Brave and clever, protective love on her young face. Pharaoh's daughter and her attendants visible approaching. The sister who saved the deliverer.
rivalry-watching-basket.energy: Protective love, clever vigilance, origin of their bond

rivalry-song-at-sea.name: Rivalry: Song at the Sea
rivalry-song-at-sea.description: Miriam leading the women parallel to Moses leading the men
rivalry-song-at-sea.prompt: Miriam with timbrel raised, leading the women in dance and song. 'Sing to the LORD!' The sea behind her, celebrating deliverance. Parallel leadership with Moses â€” he led the men in song, she leads the women. Prophetic ecstasy, triumphant joy.

rivalry-struck-leprous.name: Rivalry: Struck with Leprosy
rivalry-struck-leprous.description: Miriam stricken, Moses preparing to pray
rivalry-struck-leprous.prompt: Miriam stricken white with leprosy, outside the camp or being led out. Humbled, penitent. In the distance or approaching, Moses with hands raised beginning to pray for her healing. The challenge met with judgment, but mercy coming.
rivalry-struck-leprous.energy: Judgment and mercy, humbling and healing

rivalry-healed-by-prayer.name: Rivalry: Healed by His Prayer
rivalry-healed-by-prayer.prompt: Moses with hands raised in prayer, face anguished for his sister. Crying out the shortest, most powerful prayer: 'Please God, heal her please!' Miriam visible, waiting, the leprosy beginning to fade. The brother she saved now saves her through intercession.
